title: I.Sicily inscription 004360
support: Fragment of a marble plaque, broken on all sides (and with a break upper left but reattached); thickest upper left, slightly thinner at the base.

layout.p: Remains of three lines of text, of which only the middle line is preserved to full height. Text is laid out between double guidelines.

handNote.lettering: Relatively tall and thin letters, but still of regular square form, of somewhat irregular width, with short basic serifs at the end of strokes; somewhat roughly chiselled. R has an extended tail which does not reach to the lower line; O is tall and narrow; E has slightly shorter middle stroke. M is narrow, with very short middle strokes that join at the midpoint and join  the verticals well below the top.

provenanceFound._: Of uncertain provenance, first noted in the first volume of the museum inventory, compiled in 1885

facsimile.desc: Photo J. Prag, Aut. Assessorato Beni Culturali Regione Siciliana n.10681 del 06/05/2014

museum.name: Museo Archeologico Regionale Paolo Orsi
museum.description: An outstanding collection of archaeological material. The collection ranges from Siracusa and the surrounding territory (Megara Hyblaia, Akrai, Kasmenai etc) to encompass all of eastern Sicily, reaching as far as Gela and Agrigento. The ground floor covers prehistory through to the end of the Classical period. Upstairs includes Hellenistic and Roman Syracuse and a display of material from the catacombs. A gallery displaying material from Hellenistic eastern Sicily is in preparation.

bibl.author: Orsi
bibl.title: Notizie degli scavi di antichità
bibl.citation: Accademia nazionale dei Lincei, Istituto nazionale di archeologia e storia dell’arte (Italy), and Reale Accademia d’Italia, “Notizie degli scavi di antichità,” Notizie degli Scavi di Antichità, 1876, http://www.worldcat.org/oclc/1646037
